poa_dgns_e_{x}_ind_cd.name: MEDPAR Diagnosis E Code Present on Admission Indicator

values.Y: Diagnosis was present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'Y' for the POA Indicator.
values.N: Diagnosis was not present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will not pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'N' for the POA Indicator.
values.U: Documentation is insufficient to determine if the condition was present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will not pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'U' for the POA Indicator.
values.W: Clinically undetermined. Provider is unable to clinically determine whether condition was present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'W' for the POA Indicator.
values.1: Unreported/not used -- exempt from POA reporting -- This code is equivalent to a blank pn the UB-04, however, it was determined that blanks are undesirable when submitting this data via the 4010A. CMS will not pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as '1' for the POA Indicator. The '1' POA Indicator should not be applied to any codes on the HAC list.
values.Z: Denotes the end of the POA indicators (terminated 1/2011).
values.X: Denotes the end of the POA indicators in special data processing situations that may be identified by CMS in the future (terminated 1/2011).
values: Identifies diagnosis codes that are exempt from the POA reporting requirements (replaces the '1'). NOTE: NCH/NMUD will carry a '0' in place of a blank.

poa_dgns_{x}_ind_cd.name: MEDPAR Diagnosis Present on Admission Indicator Code

values.Y: Diagnosis was present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'Y' for the POA Indicator.
values.N: Diagnosis was not present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will not pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'N' for the POA Indicator.
values.U: Documentation is insufficient to determine if the condition was present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will not pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'U' for the POA Indicator.
values.W: Clinically undetermined. Provider is unable to clinically determine whether condition was present at the time of inpatient admission. CMS will pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as 'W' for the POA Indicator.
values.1: Unreported/not used -- exempt from POA reporting -- This code is equivalent to a blank pn the UB-04, however, it was determined that blanks are undesirable when submitting this data via the 4010A. CMS will not pay the CC/MCC DRG for those selected HACs that are coded as '1' for the POA Indicator. The '1' POA Indicator should not be applied to any codes on the HAC list.
values.Z: Denotes the end of the POA indicators (terminated 1/2011).
values.X: Denotes the end of the POA indicators in special data processing situations that may be identified by CMS in the future (terminated 1/2011).
values: Identifies diagnosis codes that are exempt from the POA reporting requirements (replaces the '1'). NOTE: NCH/NMUD will carry a '0' in place of a blank.

values.02: Discharged/transferred to other short term general hospital for inpatient care.
values.05: Discharged/transferred to another type of institution for inpatient care
values.06: Discharged/transferred to home care of organized home health service organization.
values.07: Left against medical advice or discontinued care.
values.08: Discharged/transferred to home under care of a home IV drug therapy provider.
values.09: Admitted as an inpatient to this hospital (effective 3/1/91). In situations where a patient is admitted before midnight of the third day following the day of an outpatient service, the outpatient services are considered inpatient.
values.20: Expired (did not recover - Christian Science patient).
values.41: Expired in a medical facility such as hospital, SNF, ICF, or freestanding hospice. (Hospice claims only)
values.61: Discharged/transferred within this institution to a hospital-based swing bed
values.62: Discharged/transferred to an inpatient rehabilitation facility.
values.63: Discharged/transferred to a long term care hospitals.
values.64: Discharged/transferred to a nursing facility certified under Medicaid only
values.65: Discharged/Transferred to a psychiatric hospital or psychiatric distinct unit of a hospital.
values.66: Discharged/transferred to a Critical Access Hospital (CAH)
values.71: Discharged/transferred/referred to another institution for outpatient services as specified by the discharge plan of care
values.72: Discharged/transferred/referred to this institution for outpatient services as specified by the discharge plan of care

values.8: HCFA-Developed DRG Using Claim Status Code

values.B: ESRD bene in 18-month coordination period with eghp
values.C: Conditional Medicare payment; future reimbursement expected
values.D: Auto no-fault or any liability insurance
values.F: Phs or other federal agency (other than dept of veterans affairs)

values.0: ANOMALY: invalid value, if present, translate to '9'
values.1: Non-Health Care Facility Point of Origin (Physician Referral) - The patient was admitted to this facility upon an order of a physician.
values.2: Clinical referral - The patient was admitted upon the recommendation of this facility's clinic physician.
values.3: HMO referral - Reserved for national assignment. (eff. 3/08) Prior to 3/08, HMO referral - The patient was admitted upon the recommendation of a health maintenance organization (HMO) physician.
values.4: Transfer from hospital (Different Facility) - The patient was admitted to this facility as a hospital transfer from an acute care facility where he or she was an inpatient.
values.5: Transfer from a skilled nursing facility (SNF) or Intermediate Care Facility (ICF) - The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from a SNF or ICF where he or she was a resident.
values.6: Transfer from another health care facility - The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from another type of health care facility not defined elsewhere in this code list where he or she was an inpatient.
values.7: Emergency room - The patient was admitted to this facility after receiving services in this facility's emergency room department. (Obsolete - eff. 7/1/10)
values.8: Court/law enforcement - The patient was admitted upon the direction of a court of law or upon the request of a law enforcement agency's representative. Includes transfers from incarceration facilities.
values.9: Information not available - The means by which the patient was admitted is not known.
values.A: Reserved for National Assignment. (eff. 3/08) Prior to 3/08 defined as: Transfer from a Critical Access Hospital - patient was admitted/referred to this facility as a transfer from a Critical Access Hospital.
values.B: Transfer from Another Home Health Agency - The patient was admitted to this home health agency as a transfer from another home health agency. (Discontinued July 1, 2010 - See Condition Code 47)
values.C: Readmission to Same Home Health Agency - The patient was readmitted to this home health agency within the same home health episode period. (Discontinued July 1, 2010)
values.D: Transfer from hospital inpatient in the same facility resulting in a separate claim to the payer - The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from hospital inpatient within this facility resulting in a separate claim to the payer.
values.E: Transfer from Ambulatory Surgery Center - The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from an ambulatory surgery center. (eff. 10/1/2007)
values.F: Transfer from Hospice and is under a Hospice Plan of Care or Enrolled in a Hospice Program - The patient was admitted to this facility as a transfer from a hospice. (eff. 10/1/2007)

values.1: Emergency - The patient required immediate medical intervention as a result of severe, life threatening, or potentially disabling conditions. Generally, the patient was admitted through the emergency room.
values.2: Urgent - The patient required immediate attention for the care and treatment of a physical or mental disorder. Generally, the patient was admitted to the first available and suitable accommodation.
values.3: Elective - The patient's condition permitted adequate time to schedule the availability of suitable accommodations.
values.4: Newborn - Necessitates the use of special source of admission codes.
values.5: Trauma Center - visits to a trauma center/hospital as licensed or designated by the State or local government authority authorized to do so, or as verified by the American College of Surgeons and involving a trauma activation.
